parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To cross over, pass over. From dia and a derivative of the base of peran; to cross entirely.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Phoenicia, a northern coast strip of the Roman province Syria. From phoinix; palm-country; Phoenice, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and the base of basis; to walk upon, i.e. Mount, ascend, embark, arrive.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
